page.title: 10MOBILE HOMES AT FEN PLACE
page.content: In the woods behind{Fen Place,}once the home of the{poet Shelley's ancestors, there are now over 200 mobile homes. They have been there for over 20 years. There are roads, named after birds, a{general store}and a {social club.}The park has a manager and a staff of three. The mobile homes are built in a factory and transported to the park on a lorry, with a police escort. There are many{different sizes;}a single unit is 3m wide, a twin unit is 6m wide. They are usually 12-13m long. The{maximum length}is 20m. These homes {cost}between Â£15000 and Â£42000.{Rent is also payable for the site. This is about Â£50 a month. The mobile homes come{fully furnished}and, before a home is occupied, the{garden}has shrubs and flowers planted. Of the residents, 75% are retired.
